intro: Euryops densifolius, commonly known as the denseleaf bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, and it has dense, narrow leaves that give it its common name. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance. Euryops densifolius thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal and Mediterranean climates.
